member.name: T:Dynamo.Logging.Analytics
member.summary: Utility class to support analytics tracking.

member.summary: A dummy IDisposable class

member.summary: Starts analytics client

member.name: M:Dynamo.Logging.Analytics.ShutDown
member.summary: Shuts down the client. Application life cycle end is tracked.

member.summary: Checks if anlytics tracking is enabled or not. Required for testing.

member.summary: Returns if analytics reporting is ON

member.summary: Tracks application startup time

member.summary: Tracks an arbitrary event.
member.param: A metric value associated with the event

member.summary: Tracks user preference setting and its value.

member.summary: Tracks a timed event, when it has completed.

member.summary: Tracks screen view, such as Node view, Geometry view, Custom workspace etc.

member.summary: Tracks an exception. If the exception is fatal, its recorded as crash.

member.param: A metric value associated with the event

member.summary: Creates a new command event of the given name. Start of the command is tracked. When the event is disposed, it's completion is tracked.
member.param: A metric value associated with the event

member.summary: Creates a new file operation event and tracks the start of the event. Disposing the returned event will record its completion.

member.name: F:Dynamo.Session.ParameterKeys.NumberFormat
member.summary: This key is used to get the number format used by Dynamo to format the preview values. The returned value is string.

member.summary: This key is used to get the Major version of Dynamo. The returned value is a number.

member.summary: This key is used to get the Major version of Dynamo. The returned value is a number.

member.name: F:Dynamo.Session.ParameterKeys.LastExecutionDuration
member.summary: The duration of an execution covered by an

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.SupressImportIntoVMAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify whether the item will be imported into the VM.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.IsVisibleInDynamoLibraryAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify whether the item will be displayed in the library.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ArbitraryDimensionArrayImportAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to marshal parameters or return value of a method as arbitrary dimension array in DesignScript VM. Usually this attribute is expected to be applied on IEnumerable derived object types. This attribute should be used if you expect the IEnumerable parameters or return value may hold nested collection.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ExtensionApplicationAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify the Type of class that implements IExtensionApplication interface in the specified assembly. This attribute can be used only once at assembly level. Having this attribute saves the cost of reflection on each exported types to find the type that implements IExtensionApplication interface.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.GraphicDataProviderAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify the Type of class that implements IGraphicDataProvider interface in the specified assembly. This attribute can be used only once at assembly level. Having this attribute saves the cost of reflection on each exported types to find the type that implements IGraphicDataProvider interface.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ContextDataProviderAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify the Type of class that implements IContextDataProvider interface in the specified assembly. This attribute can be used only once at assembly level. Having this attribute saves the cost of reflection on each exported types to find the type that implements IContextDataProvider interface.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ContextDataProviderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Constructor to construct this attribute with a delegate to check whether this data provider captures data.
member.param: Delegate to check if the provider can capture data

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ContextDataProviderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ContextDataProviderAttribute.Type
member.summary: Type implementing IContextDataProvider interface.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.ContextDataProviderAttribute.CapturesData
member.summary: Checks if this type can capture data interactively

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.AllowRankReductionAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be applied to methods that return collection of objects, but with some combination of input parameters it returns a collection of single object and at designscript side we want the method to return a single object instead of a collection of single object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.AllowRankReductionAttribute.ReduceRank(System.Object)
member.summary: Utility method to get the single object from the collection of single object. If the input object is neither a collection nor a collection of single object, this method returns the input object.
member.param: Input object to be converted to singleton.
member.returns: An object from the collection of single object or the input object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.AllowRankReductionAttribute.IsRankReducible(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the input object is a collection of single object.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.MultiReturnAttribute
member.summary: This attribute describes keys in the returned dictionary of a method.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.RuntimeRequirementAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be applied to method which requires some runtime support from DesignScript, e.g., tracing.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.DefaultArgumentAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be applied to parameter to specify a default argument expressions.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.PreferredShortNameAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be applied to class to give a hint for generating variable name in node to code. For example, generating variable "vec" for Vector.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.IsObsoleteAttribute
member.summary: This attribute indicates the node is obsolete

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.KeepReferenceAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute indicates the parameter will be referenced by the return object, hence its DS wrap object shouldn't be disposed even it is out of scope. The life-cycle of parameter will have the same life-cycle as the return object.
Note the type of return object should be reference type, either a pointer or an array.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.KeepReferenceThisAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute is applied to member function of zero touch libary. It indicates the return object should keep a reference to "this" object so that even "this" object is out of scope, it will not be disposed.
Note the type of return object should be reference type, either a pointer or an array.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Runtime.IsLacingDisabledAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is applied to a function to indicate whether to disable lacing strategy on this function or not.

member.summary: Clear all render data from the render package.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicItem
member.summary: Represents a graphics item object, that can provide tesselated data into the given render package.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicItem.Tessellate(Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IRenderPackage,Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters)
member.summary: Returns the graphics/tesselation data in given render package object.
member.param: The render package, where graphics data to be pushed.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ITransformable
member.summary: An interface that defines items which have a transform property, which is a 4x4 matrix.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ITransformable.RequiresCustomTransform
member.summary: A flag indicating whether the render package has had its Transform property set explicitly.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ITransformable.Transform
member.summary: A 4x4 matrix that is used to transform all geometry in the render packaage.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ITransformable.SetTransform(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the transform using a series of doubles. The resulting transform is applied to all geometry in the renderPackage. Following conventional matrix notation, m11 is the value of the first row and first column, and m12 is the value of the first row and second column. NOTE: This method should set the matrix exactly as described by the caller.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ITransformable.SetTransform(System.Double[])
member.summary: Set the transform as a double array, this transform is applied to all geometry in the renderPackage. This matrix should be laid out as follows in row vector order: [Xx,Xy,Xz, 0, Yx, Yy, Yz, 0, Zx, Zy, Zz, 0, offsetX, offsetY, offsetZ, W] NOTE: This method should transform the matrix from row vector order to whatever form is needed by the implementation.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters.Tolerance
member.summary: The tolerance for faceting. Default is -1.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters.MaxTessellationDivisions
member.summary: The maximum number of divisions for tessellation. Default is 512

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters.ShowEdges
member.summary: A flag indicating whether surface edges should be included in the RenderPackage. Default is false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters.ScaleFactor
member.summary: The scale factor set in the workspace that must be applied to distance and coordinate values used in rendering only ASM geometry. This scale factor is consumed only by LibG in its Tessellate method implementation.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicDataProvider
member.summary: This interface provides graphics data into the RenderPackage interface for given set of objects.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicDataProvider.GetGraphicItems(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a list of IGraphicItem owned by the given object.
member.param: The object for which graphics items are queried.
member.returns: List of IGraphicItem owned by the input object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicDataProvider.Tessellate(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IRenderPackage,Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.TessellationParameters)
member.summary: Returns the Graphics/Render data into the given render package.
member.param: Objects which owns some graphics items
RenderPackage where graphics/render data can be pushed/set.

member.summary: The interface that represents json data for drawing a graphic primitive

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.TriangleNormals
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit floats, 3 per vertex.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.TriangleVertexColors

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.TriangleTextureCoordinates
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit floats, 2 per vertex.

member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit floats, 3 per vertex.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.LineStripCounts
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit unsigned integers, 1 per line strip, giving the number of vertices in the strip.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.LineStripColors
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit unsigned integers, 1 per vertex, in RGBA format.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.PointVertices
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit floats, 3 per vertex.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.PointVertexColors
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit unsigned integers, 1 per vertex, in RGBA format.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.Colors
member.summary: Base-64 encoded array of 32 bit unsigned integers in RGBA format, definining a texture to apply to the triangles.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.ColorsStride
member.summary: Number of values per row in the `Colors` array.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IGraphicPrimitives.RequiresPerVertexColoration
member.summary: Whether or not the individual vertices should be colored using the data in the corresponding arrays.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IConfiguration
member.summary: Provides application configuration

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IConfiguration.RootModulePath
member.summary: Provides the path of main executing script

member.name: P:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IConfiguration.IncludeDirectories
member.summary: Provides list of include directories.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IConfiguration.GetConfigValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns application defined configuration value.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.IConfiguration.SetConfigValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set application defined configuration value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.GeometryFactory
member.summary: This key is used to configure the library filename, which implements IGeometryFactory interface.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.PersistentManager
member.summary: This key is used to configure the library filename, which implements IPersistenceManager interface.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.GeometryProvider
member.summary: This key is used to set/get IContextDataProvider implementation by host application.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.SessionDatabase
member.summary: This key is used to set the session database object for the host application. THIS IS NOW DEPRECATED (use "SessionKey" instead).

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.SessionKey
member.summary: This key is used to set the session key (by the host application) which is understood by the corresponding IPersistenceManager when it comes to telling one session from another. An example of session would be the documents in the host application, a host document can be identified with a session key, and each host document has a unique session key that IPersistenceManager can use to differentiate between two documents. The corresponding value for SessionKey is a value of "string" type.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.RequestExplicitLock
member.summary: This key is used to request explicit lock on database by the host application before execution of the script. The corresponding value is bool.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.RecordingUserActions
member.summary: This key is used to check if the application is recording user actions. The corresponding value is bool.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.ClearPersistedObjects
member.summary: This key is used to determine if the persistent objects should be cleared on screen before each run. In live execution scenarios like DesignScript Studio, there is no clear distinction between runs. For more information, please see "AsmExtensionApplication::OnBeginExecution" in "AsmExtensionApplication.cpp".

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.GeometricPreviewEnabled
member.summary: This key is being referenced in "DesignScriptStudio.Graph.Ui.GraphControl" as a way to determine if the underlying "RenderService" should be enabled. The default behaviour (if this flag is not specified) is to enable geometric preview. The "object" value being passed for this configuration key is expected to be a "bool" object rather than a "string" object.

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.FilteredClasses
member.summary: This key is being referenced in "DesignScriptStudio.Graph.Ui.GraphControl" as a way to filtered out classes that is currently not supported in ProtoGL. The "object" value being passed for this configuration key is expected to be a "string" object which specified the assembly and class that should be hidden. The location of the config file is "\installtools\Bundle\ DesignScript.bundle\Contents\Win64" The format of the string should be "%assemblyName%;%className&;..;%assemblyName%;%className&;", The CoreCoponent will look for "%assemblyName%;%className&;" (with two ';' at end of assembly name and class name) and filter the fully matched item out

member.name: F:Autodesk.DesignScript.Interfaces.ConfigurationKeys.GeometryXmlProperties
member.summary: This key is referenced in the geometry test framework. The value type for this key is bool. If the value is true, that means the core will generate XML properties.
